intro: Machaerina teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, adapting to the harsh conditions of its environment. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with branches that are often covered in fine hairs. Machaerina teretifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
